page.title: 10CHADDESDEN POLICE STATION
page.content: P.C.Roberts is one of{Chaddesden's {Community Police Officers.}He walks a beat around the area. The police no longer use Panda cars so that they can be more in touch with the community. An{inspector}is in charge of the Station, with a C.I.D. department and a total of fifty policemen and policewomen working at the station. The officers work night, afternoon or morning shifts. Inside the station there is a dining room, changing rooms, a store for valuables such as radios, and offices where all the records are filed. There are books of photographs of criminals for witnesses to look through and finger printing equipment for suspects. There is also a van and equipment for catching stray dogs. The police use their own trained German shepherd dogs to track and catch criminals.
